text:
Growler fill at the brewery.

Very enjoyable sweet/milk stout. Extremely smooth to drink - will definitely have again!

10floz draft served in a medium sized snifter. Basically black in appearance with a ring of foam. Nose has a husky, roasted malt aroma. The palate is a heavy medium and somewhat robust. Mostly straight forward dark roast flavor with faint coconut upon the follow through.
Crowler. Black color with a medium head. Strong coconut aroma. Moderate coconut flavor, with some milk sugar and very light roast. Medium body.
Dark black. Nice. Velvetty smooth. Creamy. A hint of butter. Coconut. Quite tasty.

Tap at the source with blonderedhead. 10 oz pour. Coffee black in color with tan head. Nose is roasty and malty with coffee and chocolate notes. Spectacular aroma. Taste is predominantly roasted malts with a coffee like bitterness offset by the coconut sugary sweetness. Alcohol makes its presence felt a little bit but not at the expense of the quality of flavor. Almost a slight dark fruit characteristic that gives way to a dark chocolate finish. Very delicious. I would put it a notch above the standard chocolate milk stout. Dangerous Man delivers yet again.

Tap. Pours opaque black, large creamy tan head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, toasted coconut, lactose sugar, cocoa powder. Flavors is medium sweet, very light bitter, loads of coconut, milk chocolate, mounds bar, roasted malt, hints of marshmallow. Medium body, silky mouthfeel. Solid adjunct Stout for sure.

Minnesota Beer Trip #230. Keg at the brewery, 5/13/16. Dark brown, large creamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of chocolate, popcorn, peanuts. The taste is roasted malts, chocolate, coconut, vanilla. Medium bodied, low carbonation.
Crowler of this one - coconut was subtle but there, good but I like the regular CMS better.

Black pour with a single finger tan colored head. Lace present. Aroma is light, hints of chocolate, marshmallow. Full bodied, silky smooth. Taste is full of coconut, but does not taste artificial. Kind of like chocolate milk with toasted coconut added. One of the tastiest coconut beers Ive had.
On tap at the brewery. Very good sweet stout with a hint of coconut. Impressed.

Crowler. Deep brown with minimal head. Chocolate milk, dry roasted almonds, faint toasted coconut and roasted malts. Moderately sweet with a dry roasty finish with the toasted coconut contributing to the flavor a little more than the aroma but still in the background. Medium body with a watery feel.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear dark brown with a light brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a strong dark grain note with roasted malts and a bit of coconut. Flavor is dark grain and roasted make forward with just a hint of coconut.

Approximately 10 oz. pour from a growler during a tasting on 11-21-15. Thanks to falco242. Pours dark brown with a small to moderate amount of light tan head. Nice smell features scents of coconut and coconut husk. Mounds candy bar flavor. Really good. Lively and frothy in the palate. Medium body. Darn good beer overall, although not as stellar as some of the early ratings here suggest. Dangerous Man Peanut Butter Porter this is not.
Tap; pours nearly black with a thin tan head; aroma of coconut, roasted malt, and hint of milk sugar; taste is coconut and roasted malt; dry finish with a hint of bitterness; nicely done

Keg @ Dangerous Man. Dee brown pour with a thick creamy tan head. Nose full of dark chocolate and rich toasted coconut. Sweet and inviting stuff. Taste is sweet, dat. Coconut-forward. Some charred grain and mellow coffee. Oily, substantial. Nice.
Draft. Radek brown. Light tan collared head. Roast coffee note. Medium mouthfeel. Coconut, dark chocolate, and roast coffee. Tasty stuff.
Had this after the Imperial chocolate milk stout, which was an amazing beer. This one was very nice but the coconut was somewhat subdued. Great chocolate, coffee and dark fruit notes

Pour on tap at APN 2013, dark brownish black pour with creamy tan head, aroma brought dark chocolate, roast, coffee, slight hints of a spicy tone, the coconut if you search for it was barely present, but not much difference from the chocolate version. Taste was similar, dark cocoa, roast, coffee, slight earth and dark fruits, slight sweet coconut finishing fairly bitter.
Draft at All Pints North. Nice coconut in the nose and a bit more subtle in the taste. Dark black pour, tan head.
Pour at the tap room. Wow huge coconut aroma, coffee, chocolate, marshmallow, and an earthy smoky smell. Flavor is coconut, chocolate, light coffee, and caramel. Amazing beer!! Full of flavor.

Tap @ Dangerous Man. Pours a deep brown appearance with a dark brown head. Huge coconut, marshmallow, sweet vanilla, nutty, chocolate, immense coconut aroma. Chewy coconut meat, dark chocolate, light caramel flavor. Ye gods there is a lot of coconut in this motherfucker. Fuck yeah.

On tap and out of the growler, this is a tasty beer.  Dark beer with lacy, coffee colored head.  The coconut is as prounced as Id like but is noticable.  Lots of roasted malt that almost over power the coconut, but nice and sweet.  Good chocolate flavor too.  Dangerous man rocks (altho 3 hour tour at town hall is my coconut beer of choice)
Black with a lacing head. Thick, smooth palate. Big coconut aroma and flavor, and the flavor also has the roasted malt of the milk stout. Full palate and full flavor. This is a great beer.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2013 Poured from a growler dated April 2nd. Pours a nice rich dark coffee color with a bit of a tan head that quickly fades. Aroma is coconut get some lactose sugar, nice coffee and chocolate balance as well. Taste is a bit of roasted coconut and chocolate, finishes with a light coffee bitter, body was a lot thinner than I expected. Just had it on tap and it has a much better body and coconut flavor is much more potent on tap, try it fresh!

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Tap at the brewpub. Yahtzee! This is spectacular. Jet black pour with a cream head. Toasted coconut and smooth roasted malts throughout. Not over-complicated, just features the good stuff. Best brew to date from this brewer.
Tap at brewery.  Pours black with a little tan head. Aroma is coconut and roasted malts. Flavor is nice coconut. Excellent creamy mouthfeel. Very solid.
From tap at brewery. Amazing aroma! Pours nearly black with tanish head.  Smooth finish. Excellent!
